description:
Hi friends, welcome to this course on guide to do a step by step Discounted Cash Flow valuation for a company.

What is the course about?

This course will give you a conceptual and practical illustration of a cash flow based approach to valuation of a company. You will learn a detailed step by step process to carry out a valuation exercise of a company for which you have been given forecasted financials for next 5 years in future.

Who should take this course?

This course is meant for all sorts of business and financial analysts who are required to do a valuation of companies for investment purposes. The course is a good one for early tenured analysts who want to learn about the technique in a practical illustration as well for tenured professionals who want to refresh the understanding of how DCF valuation approach works.

What do you need to know before signing up?

As you can understand that this is a specialized topic for which there needs to some understanding of the financial statements of a company especially income statement and balance sheet. What will also help if the students are already investing in stock markets or want to know what drives the price of a company trading in stock market.

Why take this course from us?

We are sure there are many such courses out there, however we feel that this course is different from others-

1) It gives us a detailed understanding of what is the discounted cash flow valuation technique from a conceptual point of view.

2) You get a step by step guide on doing a Discounted cash flow for any company. There is a standardized template that can help you to apply in your real life situations.

3) We have decades of experience in doing this for our large clients on a daily basis. So you benefit a lot from our valuable experience and it will show in the quality of the content that you will have access to.

4) We will be with you even after the course. Our expert faculty team is available to you 24x7 to help you solve any queries you may have around DCF valuation.
title: Step-by-step guide to do a Discounted Cash Flow Valuation
